And you, you fat Miss Molly your shoes look like they're dipped in shit!
I wanna see my face in those!
If you cunts are not back here tonight lookin' like the belle of the fuckin' ball I'll make you wish you were never born, understood?
They'll be like nuns in church, lieutenant. You have my word.
Polish your boots and brush your coat.
indistinct chatter We are honored to welcome Captain Goodwin to our post.
We trust your visit here will be a fruitful one, captain.
To start the evenin' off I'd like to call on our little nightingale to sing a good old British love song for all us homesick lads.

applause whistling laughter fiddle music âª As I went walking one morning in May âª âª I met a young couple âª âª So fondly did stray âª âª And one was a young maid so sweet and so fair âª âª And the other was a soldier and a brave grenadier âª âª And they kissed so sweet and comforting âª âª As they clung to each other âª âª They went arm in arm along the road âª âª Like sister and brother âª âª They went arm in arm along the road âª âª Till they came to a stream âª âª And they both sat down together love âª âª To hear the nightingale sing âªâª indistinct chatter laughing Fuckin' hell!
Jago's taken him to look at the sentries.
I bet he likes it up the windward passage, that one.
Go and find his nibs, will you?
Got a full day of arsekissing tomorrow.
...I got in Hobart especially for you.
You'll insult me if you don't take it.
âª As I went awalkin'... âªâª Oh, not that one.

âª I wish my love was a butterfly âª âª I'd light on my love's breast âª âª Or if I was a blue cuckoo âª âª I'd sing my love to rest âª âª Or if I was a blackbird âª âª I'd sing till the daylight clear âª âª I'd sit and sing âª âª For you my love âª âª For I have loved you dear âªâª God, you're beautiful.
Every man in that room wanted you tonight.
Sir, my letter of recommendation sir, it's due three months ago now.
I'll send it when I'm ready.
I'm meant to be in the care of my husband now, sir.
Didn't I rescue you from that hellhole of a prison?
They warned me you'd be too much trouble. I took you on, anyway.
You'd still be there if it weren't for me.
I'm very grateful for that, sir.
I let you marry the Irishman.
Not good enough for Her Highness?
I'm very grateful to you, sir.
I even got you your own horse.
No other convict in the district's got their own horse.
Aidan worked for that horse for three years, sir.
Oh, here it comes. This is the part where she cries.
sobs I'm sorry, sir. I'm sorry.
I decide when you leave and when you stay.
You're doing this deliberately, with the captain here.
You're doing it deliberately to get at me.
I shouldn't have said nothing, sir.
I need to get my baby.
screams breathing heavily birdsong gunshot laughter Fix your sleeve.
Your soldiers have been firing off their guns for no reason.
They do that, sir, to ward off the blacks.
They were rotten drunk and firing at the night sky, lieutenant.
Some of us are living the high life while I take care of their screaming babies!
You can take that dress off.
I'm taking it off now, damn you!
You can start on the boilers before dawn.
And the little bird was so frightened.
She thought she was going to die out there in the forest all alone.
She called out in her sweet baby voice to see if her ma could hear her.
Her voice was so pure it carried for miles through the trees.
...her ma came flying down and scooped her up in her breast.
And the little baby bird chirped with delight.
She held on tight through the trees till they came to a beautiful place where she and her ma and da could all live happily together.
The sun shone brightly and the air was clear.
He'll send it when he's ready.
I'm demandin' it first thing in the mornin'.
No, you can't order him to do anything. It won't work.
He owes you your ticket, Clare.
You've served your time and then some.
I'll kill him if he hurt you!
Stop it will you, you fool.
I fell and hit my head on the stove.
We can go somewhere no one'll find us.
We have a few coins saved, we'll work it out.
if I got caught without a ticket I'd be sent straight back to that prison and I'd lose you both.
Do you want to be chained to him forever Clare?
I'm meant to be looking after you now.
I'll be the nicest, most politest man...
ravens cawing indistinct chatter indistinct chatter laughter What are you made of? Come on.
Not long now, we'll be calling you captain.
Won't be bendin' over for the likes of him when I'm captain.
gasps What? Give me a slice, sir!
I'm so... I'm sorry, I'm sorry.
laughter You've had five soldiers flogged and in the clink already, sergeant.
Do you want the rest of them in there?
clamoring indistinct singing  Have you been drinking?
I'm just gonna talk to him.
I asked you nice this mornin'.
She's been askin' for three months.
Every week you say you're gonna send the letter and every week you don't.
Why won't you let her go?
She's paid her dues and so have I.
And she's my property so I'll do what I want with her.
grunts grunts groans In your office, lieutenant.
What the hell were you thinking, fightin' an officer?
He's a troublemaker, sir, he and his wife.
And what is she to you?
Do you think I'm an idiot?
The lieutenant governor finds moral indiscretion in his officers abhorrent.
I've spent enough time here now.
Noted your conduct and that of your soldiers.
I'm afraid I can't recommend you for the captaincy up north.
But I was told by the lieutenant colonel himself that he would put me forward to Major Bexley.
And I'm afraid I can't recommend you.
Sir, I took on this post with the promise it would be one year.
Three years later, I'm still here.
I've been handed the sorriest band of soldiers that ever sullied the British Army and still I've had consistent results.
I've civilized the land got rid of the blacks, made it safe...
No one owes you anything, lieutenant!
There is no officer in this colony who's put in more work than me, no one who knows it better.
If an officer can't even control the convict detritus that surrounds him how on earth could he command a bigger post up north?
I'll travel north to Launceston, see Major Bexley meself and apply for the position in person.
The post will be filled in four to five days, I'd say.
Well, no other officer knows the colony better than you.
Why don't you take your nag and ride up?
It's nigh on impossible to get a horse up that way from here.
Then take some men and walk it.
We're headed up north to Launceston first thing through the interior.
Yes, it's fucking dangerous, you fatheaded lobcock!
But we're not ready yet, sir.
I haven't handed things over to the corporal.
We don't have any supplies, no black tracker.
Drink up. We're paying a visit.
I don't have a good feeling about this.
I lose my ticket, go back to the pen, and you're left alone with him?
I'd rather us face the wild, take our chances.
It's freezing for her out there.
You remember how to pack this?
That's just the way, isn't it?
You don't want trouble, but sometimes trouble wants you.
baby wailing What, are you gonna shoot me now, you Irish cunt?
You're nothing but the shit on my shoe.
He's drunk, sir. He's very sorry for what he did. We both are.
laughs Did she not tell you?
Oh, we've been fucking like mad since she pushed that brat out.
Got the scratches on my back to prove it.
Says I'm the best she's ever had.
You want to see how she likes it?
groans grunting gunshot sobbing wailing You've wanted to try it.
moans crying baby wailing Shut it up.
Shut it up or I will!
screams  Will you shut it up?
thud moaning You ruined it, Jago, you dolt.
instrumental music gasps sobbing screams No!
sobs Oh, no, no! Oh, dear.
You were meant to be here at sunup.
What have you done to the babe?
He left at dawn with the sergeant and the young ensign.
To take up that new post, he said.
No, damn you, I told you!
My husband is lying dead in a shack murdered by your officers.
You want me to take the word of a woman convict over that of an officer?
Are you going to help me or not?
I can write up a report, send it to Hobart.
I've only just got me ticket meself.
They'll put me back where I come from away from Luddy.
Aidan would have died for you.
Are you gonna leave him in a cold, dark grave while his murderers are free to do as they please?
He was my friend, too, Clare.
And we loved the little one.
I want you to bury them under that tree.
Put her in his arms so she's safe.
What in Christ's name are you doing?
You don't even know where you're going!
Should I stay home and do needlework?
At least take a guide, for God's sake.
There's a guide that I work with.
He's smart and knows the land.
Those black ones, they know the way...
I'm not traveling with a black.
End up in a pot of someone's dinner.
What are you trying to do to me?
I can't let you go out there on your own.
I've got a job for ya.
I told them to bugger off.
Uncle Charlie go with them instead.
I'm not helping you white bastards no more.
I'm not workin' for no bloody white woman.
One now and one when you get me to the soldiers that came by this morning.
I'll cash this jewelry for the rest.
If you kill me before the job's done you won't find anyone who'll take these for coin.
So don't even think about it.
Do you want the job or not?
My husband's traveling with those men.
You get me to my husband, then take us both to Launceston.
You give me one shilling now, we go tomorrow.
You take me now or I'll find someone who will.
You're not taking that horse with you. Too slow.
Go the wrong way, if you want.
You've been looking like a scared little girl all day.
Good choice, Ruse. A skeleton, a simpleton and a midget.
All the other convicts are off finishing the bridge.
I can shine your boots, make a fire, fetch your water and run faster and work harder than them old farts.
It appears the midget has some balls, lieutenant.
baby crying gunshot There they go! Did you see?
Are you soft in the head?
I've lost him now, thanks to you.
They would have killed the wife and young'uns, too if we didn't come home early.
You cannot go out there on your own!
There's a war on, you know.
flies buzzing rustling gasps Jesus Christ Almighty!
Don't sneak up on me like that.
Our people cleared that land so we could hunt, get food.
Then you white devils come put sheeps on it.
Told us to get off our land.
You go anywhere near that house and I'll leave you here.
Maybe we can eat that bloody horse.
Three more days till we're up north.
He'll get you in your sleep.
They eat little ones like you.
Says he, the great protector of children.
Just thinkin' of what happened, sir.
Some Irish convict scum trying to kill an officer.
He went for me with his musket.
The world will thank us for it.
Even if she didn't, who's gonna do anything about it?
For all anyone knows her husband killed the baby in a rage.
Then he set upon her, so she shot him.
We could hang for it, sir.
This is the last time you'll mention it, ensign to anyone.
And when I look at your stupid face from this point on I wanna see a permanent fucking smile.
Look on the bright side, sir.
Two months in Van Diemen's Land and you're already a baby killer.
If either of you do anything to jeopardize this post for me I swear I'll leave you in the fucking bush to rot!
urinates baby wails baby wailing snarling Shut it up or I will!
gasps snarling thunder rumbling horse snorts grunts Come on, sweetheart.
grunts They went that way, five of them.
They go fast. Hardly no stop.
How long till we reach them?
Well, can't we go a quicker way?
That way quicker way, catch 'em up today.
There's only army men through here.
Your husband a soldier, is he?
sniggers I need to get to my husband.
What sort of a husband lets a woman travel out here on her own?
Me and my mate, we're partial to a bit of Irish cunny.
You stay here a while, there'll be a decent coin in it for ya.
I wouldn't touch you if my life depended on it.
Then show me your papers, you Irish cunt.
When my husband finds out what you said..
Every time something bad happens you're nowhere to be found.
I'm paying you to protect me!
Those ones who see a blackfella, they shoot a blackfella.

babbling Come on Koa, come on.
I've never seen one like you before.

What in the hell are you doing bringing one here?
Where there's one, there's ten, sergeant.
She was with a bunch of dead ones.
She was just cryin' like this.
I swear they were all dead.
This was the only live one.
I just wanna try one, sir.
screams I done plenty of things for you, sir.
This is the least you could do for me.
You can swive her first, sir.
This was the only live one.
Tie her up to the cart.
Any problems, that's the end of it.
Get to 'em today if the river not too high.
You said we would make it.
gasps snorts gasps gasping gasping gasping coughing gasping coughing Hey.
gunshot Plenty of food out here I could get.
I can make spear to hunt.
Why don't you go and do it now then?
Say, "You'll be like white boy now.
You do it whitefella way." Whitefella way is shit way.
You think you're the only one with problems?
I've looked after meself since I was a kid.
Me mother worked herself to an early grave.
I lived on the streets, stole what I could to survive.
And now I'm here at the arse end of the world with you.
Full of misery from top to bottom.
I'm not "God Save The King" like them white bastards sing.
The blackbird Flying high over the mountains Stop!
I am Mangana Flying high over the mountains Stop it!
My brothers, my father, my uncles..
Them whitefella shot 'em all in front of me when I was a kid.
Them whitefella take me far from my family.
Say, "You be like white boy now." I don't never wanna be like white boy.
That big boss you following, he's the worst one.
He make me take him to blackfella then he shoot the blackfella.
I'm not working for no bloody whitefella no more.
I'm gonna find my mother, my aunties.
Go back home to my country so you can't hurt me no more.
Damn all the English to hell!

Oh I wish that I could see Even if I lived just one week after Our young king and one thousand warriors Banishing all the foreigners Ohro You are welcome home Ohro You are welcome home Ohro You are welcome home Now that summer's coming No!
Can you read or write, Eddie?
I'll teach you how to write your name.
metal scraping Someone's gotta get us tucker.
If I was gonna kill ya, I would have done it by now.
Left you in the river or with them devils last night.

You white ones go fast, fast, fast get nowhere.
I go slow, get everything done.
panting groans grunts Them tracks here, older ones.
That big fella, the soldier one.

You know what it's like to have a whitefella take everything you have, don't you?
They stole something from me and I need to get it back.
It's all I could get, sir.
It was the best thing you could have got.
At least we can get drunk tonight.
You did better than the sergeant.
No tears now. Be a man.
You know how to work a pistol?
You can have some rum, too, once we stop.
Keep a lookout at the rear.
That way if they attack again, you'll be the first to go.
I'll give you big reward if you get us there by tomorrow, boy.
Go get Becky and wait for me there.
I didn't mean to kill the babe.
I just wanted it to be quiet.
screaming screaming grunts screams coughs Die!
sobbing screaming sobbing bird chirping wings fluttering Boy.

Do you know how much she's worth?

I can't be out here on my own.
What did he do to ya to make you do that to him?
You're not lookin' for your husband, are ya?
You don't have a baby no more.
Blackfella chasing you now 'cause you killed that woman.
Blackfella not go up mountain way.
birds chirping crow cawing Bad spirits here. Very bad.
...I'll not baulk to put a shot in your brain!

Charlie will get you there tomorrow to meet the big boss.
No one go up that way, not even blackfella.
We go long way around, still get to 'em tomorrow.
You need to wash them clothes.
If I saw them white ones the ones that killed my family..
...I would have done what you did.
I wanted to come tell you we're alright.
gasps My auntie made a paste.
Make milk dry up, pain go away.
groans We stay, I do smoke ceremony.
I don't want you puttin' your hocuspocus on me.
bird screeching You see that one?
He'll help you, show you the way.
groans My country up there not far away Milaythina Kanamaluka She is my country She is my mother Mangana the blackbird sings He sings for me and my home You will be safe now.
gasping shudders Got a good one.

You'll be a king up here.
You need to get me off this mountain and into Launceston now.
Is long way from town here.
I'll come back later, see how you're doin'.
I'll give you whatever you want.
You won't ever have to work again, boy!
And don't call me boy, you England bastard.
gunshot He... he  he was makin' fun of ya.

There was only one person who could have got us out of here and it was that fucking black cunt!
Two days to a captaincy or rot out here in this hellhole.
That's the situation, isn't it, Ruse?
You got rid of our last one so you're the new one.
You got one day to get us to Launceston, alright?
I'll make you the sergeant now, Eddie.
Do you remember how to use it?
And if this boy puts a foot out of place..
sobbing What did they do to you?
I've got to start work in a day.
Kill him or let him live?
Kill him or let him live?
gasping You owe your life to a child.
sobbing chanting I'll help you get the men.
We'll never get Becky around that ridge.

You gonna let them get away?
No time to be a bloody coward.
You don't know what you're talkin' about.
I'll be the first to put a shot in their heads myself.
Not too high. They'll see ya.
gunshot gasps We need to get up there now!
I want this all to stop.
I'll get you out of here, I promise.
But we have to go now.
I don't have anything else from him.
I promise I'll come get ya.
I thought you were too good for us, boy.
So what are you doing here, you piece of shite?

Well, she'll die out here without you, that I do know.

This one's gonna take us to town.
Don't take your eyes from him.

As soon as I get to Launceston, I'll tell the authorities there's a convict on the loose.
That will get you five more years.
I can do better, sir, please.
Please don't leave me here, please!
I'll shoot the next one, I will.
I'll shoot the next one, I will!
I can't stand the fucking noise of it.
birds chirping fluttering screeching screeching Where am I?

laughing Please may I ride on the back, sir?

whistles Giddy up, giddy up, giddy up.
hens clucking flies buzzing flies buzzing indistinct singing Billy.

indistinct chatter You can tell me to shut up.

I'll have you arrested, you drunken whore.
scoffs I belong to me and no one else!
